definition: deeply grateful
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
favor/grace/kindness
surname Dai
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]
virtue/goodness/morality/ethics/kindness/favor/character/kind

sentences.english: He should be grateful to the Fuehrer that he still has private property.
sentences.chinese: 他應該爲自己還擁有私有財產而對元首感恩戴德。

sentences.english: Power takes as inacknowledgment the askews of its victims.
sentences.chinese: 勢力以爲就義者的痛苦是感恩戴德。

sentences.english: He go to where, but someone deceptive.
sentences.chinese: 他走到哪裏，卻總有人感恩戴德。

sentences.english: His whole heart melted in gratitude, and he loved more and more.
sentences.chinese: 他的心完全溶化在感恩戴德的情感中了。

sentences.english: Never have so many person been so deeply gratitude to so few persons.
sentences.chinese: 從來都沒有過的人對這麼少的人感恩戴德如此之深。

sentences.english: They also make themselves more beholden to campaign donors, corrupting government.
sentences.chinese: 他們當然會對金主們感恩戴德，然後腐化政府。

definition: to shed tears of gratitude (idiom); moved to tears
grateful and seeking to repay the kindness (idiom)
lit. the kindness of recognizing sb's worth and employing him (idiom)/patronage/protection
benevolence/favor
to recall fondly/to remember with emotion
generous treatment
kindness/affection/grace/favor
to treat sb favorably/to view in a new light
bowed head and ears glued (idiom); docile and obedient/at sb's beck and call
a benefactor/a person who has significantly helped sb else
sincerely grateful
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
to hold sb in the same regard as one would a god (idiom)
toss a peach, get back a plum (idiom); to return a favor/to exchange gifts/Scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours.
to be hell-bent on/dead set on sth/unswerving
to repay/to requite
